text: The 2019–20 season was Partick Thistle's second consecutive season in the second tier of Scottish football in the newly established Scottish Championship, having been relegated from the Scottish Premiership at the end of the 2017–18 season. Partick Thistle also competed in the League Cup, the Scottish Challenge Cup and the Scottish Cup. On 15 April, the SPFL voted to end the lower leagues in Scottish football due to the coronavirus pandemic and as a result Partick were relegated to League One after two years in the Championship, which the club decided not to take legal action against.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/52315021 ==Season Summary== Gary Caldwell began the season as manager but was sacked on 18 September, leaving the club bottom of the Championship table. On 23 September, he was succeeded by former manager Ian McCall who had left his post at Ayr United. Former Manager, Alan Archibald returned this time as assistant, and Neil Scally also joined as assistant. The club lost chairman and EuroMillions winner Colin Weir who died at the age of 71.https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-50930002 He was replaced by former chairman by Jacqui Low in February.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/51680944 ==Competitions== ===Scottish Championship=== ===Scottish League Cup=== ===Scottish Challenge Cup=== ===Scottish Cup=== ==Squad statistics== ===Appearances=== Updated: 5 March 2020 |- |colspan="14"|Players who left the club during the season: |} ==Club statistics== ===League table=== ====League Cup table==== ===Club staff=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="background:red; color:yellow;" scope="col"|Name ! style="background:red; color:yellow;" scope="col"|Role |- | Ian McCall|| Manager |- | Alan Archibald||Assistant Manager |- | Neil Scally||Assistant Manager |- | Kenny Arthur||Goalkeeping Coach |- | Scott Allison||Thistle Weir Youth Academy Director |- | Ryan McCann||Head of Professional Phase Coaching |- | Martin Christie||Chief Scout |- | Greg McKean||Club Doctor |- | Katy Stanton||Physiotherapist |- | Allan Findlay||Groundsman |- | Paul McDonald||Kit Manager Source: ==See also== * List of Partick Thistle F.C. seasons ==References== Category:Partick Thistle F.C. seasons Partick Thistle
